content.description: Climb the crack to the left facing corner.  move around the roof to the right and up the large flakes to the notch at the top.
content.location: First crack to the left of the main corner.

content.description: Looking at this off-width is deceiving as it climbs much more like a flake and is quite enjoyable.  There are two starts and it depends on your climbing skill to which start may be easier.  One start is Inner Space, directly at the base of the off width crack standing atop the stack of blocks.  The other start is to the right outside of the corner, using a high jug on the right face and then steaming back over to the left wall.  Continue following the corner out left over the roof where it turns into a flake.  Climb up to the top on easy terrain.
content.location: The inside corner of the tallest main outcrop on the upper west end.

content.description: Ascends the striking shallow crack to the jug filled roofs.  This route could be 5.7 if you used the back wall for the first half of the climb.  For the 5.11 route the beginning moves are pretty convoluted and require some flexibility.  Start at the base of the crack with a hand size pocket, while also using the small ledge at the left corner of the wall. The opposite wall is off limits!  Work up the crack to the jugs straight above.
content.location: Located at the upper end of the outcrop (West end) and best found from the top as it's a 4 to 5 foot wide chasm splitting the top of the outcrop.  It's also on the North facing wall.

content.description: Routes on the Upper West End Outcrops, including the small pinnacle.  Some routes reach close to 30' tall.  This area Faces North.
